note.p: Corrected proof of "Old Age's Ship and Crafty Death's" with notations in Whitman's hand.

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: Walt Whitman Papers in the Charles E. Feinberg Collection: Literary File, 1841-1919; Poetry, 1842-1892; “Old Age's Ship and Crafty Death's” ( 1890 ); Proof sheets with corrections and notations
bibl.idno: MSS18630, box 28, folder Old Age's Ship and Crafty Death's (1890). Proof Sheets.
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

lg.l: From east and west across the horizon's edge,
Two mighty masterful vessels sailers steal upon us:

But we'll make race a-time upon the seas—a battle-contest
yet! bear lively there!
(Our joys of strife and derring-do to the last!)
Put on the old ship all her power to-day!

Out challenge and defiance—flags and flaunting pennants
added,
As we take to the open—take to the deepest, freest waters.
